etri.sdn.controller.module.firewall

Class FirewallStorage

  • java.lang.Object
    • etri.sdn.controller.OFModel
      • etri.sdn.controller.module.firewall.FirewallStorage

  • public class FirewallStorage
extends OFModel
    This class is a storage to manage firewall rules. FirewallStorage has FirewallEntryTable class which supports basic storage operations against a memory storage and a persistent database.
    Author:
    jshin

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class etri.sdn.controller.OFModel

      • synchronizeStorage

        public void synchronizeStorage(java.util.Collection<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> entrySet)
        Copies all entry of the persistent database into the memory storage at initial booting stage. When the controller is rebooted, all firewall rules need to be loaded into memory storage for consistency.
        Parameters:
        entrySet - all firewall rules of the persistent database

      • printStorage

        public void printStorage()
        Compares entries of the memory storage and the persistent database. This method is only used for debug.

      • insertDBEntry

        public boolean insertDBEntry(IStorageService firewallDB,
                    java.lang.String dbName,
                    java.lang.String collectionName,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> rule)
        Stores a new firewall rule into the persistent database.
        Parameters:
        firewallDB - a persistent database name
        dbName - the name of the persistent database
        collectionName - the name of the collection for the database
        rule - a firewall rule to insert
        Returns:
        true when inserted

      • deleteDBEntry

        public boolean deleteDBEntry(IStorageService firewallDB,
                    java.lang.String dbName,
                    java.lang.String collectionName,
                    int ruleid)
        Removes the firewall rule from database using key field of ruleid. This method searches for the target entry from the database first and deletes the target entry if the rule associated with the given ruleid exists.
        Parameters:
        firewallDB - a persistent database name
        dbName - the name of the persistent database
        collectionName - the name of the collection for the database
        ruleid - the ruleid of firewall rule to delete
        Returns:
        true when deleted, false when fails to search

      • getDBEntry

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getDBEntry(IStorageService firewallDB,
                                                          java.lang.String dbName,
                                                          java.lang.String collectionName,
                                                          int ruleid)
        Returns the firewall rule associated with the input ruleid from the database.
        Parameters:
        firewallDB - a persistent database name
        dbName - the name of the persistent database
        collectionName - the name of the collection for the database
        ruleid - the ruleid of firewall rule to be searched
        Returns:
        the firewall rule associated with the given ruleid, null when fails to search

      • getAllDBEntries

        public java.util.Collection<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object>> getAllDBEntries(IStorageService firewallDB,
                                                                                     java.lang.String dbName,
                                                                                     java.lang.String collectionName)
        Returns all firewall rules from the database.
        Parameters:
        firewallDB - a persistent database name
        dbName - the name of the persistent database
        collectionName - the name of the collection for the database
        Returns:
        all firewall rules, null when the database is empty
